1.1_text_alternatives.title: Text Alternatives
1.1_text_alternatives.description: Provide text alternatives for any non-text content

requirements.title: Non-text Content
requirements.description: All non-text content that is presented to the user has a text alternative that serves the equivalent purpose

implementation.compliance_method: All images, charts, and graphics have descriptive alt text

requirements.title: Captions (Prerecorded)
requirements.description: Captions are provided for all prerecorded audio content in synchronized media

requirements.title: Audio Description or Media Alternative (Prerecorded)
requirements.description: An alternative for time-based media or audio description of the prerecorded video content is provided for synchronized media

requirements.title: Audio Description (Prerecorded)
requirements.description: Audio description is provided for all prerecorded video content in synchronized media

implementation.notes: Currently not applicable as we don't have audio/video content, but will implement if added

1.3_adaptable.title: Adaptable
1.3_adaptable.description: Create content that can be presented in different ways

requirements.title: Info and Relationships
requirements.description: Information, structure, and relationships conveyed through presentation can be programmatically determined or are available in text

requirements.title: Meaningful Sequence
requirements.description: When the sequence in which content is presented affects its meaning, a correct reading sequence can be programmatically determined

requirements.title: Sensory Characteristics
requirements.description: Instructions provided for understanding and operating content do not rely solely on sensory characteristics

requirements.title: Orientation
requirements.description: Content does not restrict its view and operation to a single display orientation

requirements.title: Identify Input Purpose
requirements.description: The purpose of each input field collecting information about the user can be programmatically determined when appropriate

implementation.compliance_method: Use semantic HTML elements, proper heading hierarchy, ARIA labels where needed

1.4_distinguishable.title: Distinguishable
1.4_distinguishable.description: Make it easier for users to see and hear content

requirements.title: Use of Color
requirements.description: Color is not used as the only visual means of conveying information

requirements.title: Audio Control
requirements.description: If any audio plays automatically for more than 3 seconds, either a mechanism is available to pause or stop the audio, or a mechanism is available to control audio volume independently from the overall system volume level

requirements.title: Contrast (Minimum)
requirements.description: The visual presentation of text and images of text has a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1

requirements.title: Resize text
requirements.description: Text can be resized up to 200% without assistive technology and without loss of content or functionality

requirements.title: Reflow
requirements.description: Content can reflow without horizontal scrolling at widths down to 320 CSS pixels

requirements.title: Non-text Contrast
requirements.description: Visual information required to identify user interface components has a contrast ratio of at least 3:1

requirements.title: Text Spacing
requirements.description: No loss of content or functionality when users change letter, word, paragraph, and line spacing

implementation.compliance_method: Ensure minimum contrast ratios, support text resizing, implement responsive design

2.1_keyboard_accessible.title: Keyboard Accessible
2.1_keyboard_accessible.description: Make all functionality available from a keyboard

requirements.title: Keyboard
requirements.description: All functionality of the content is operable through a keyboard interface

requirements.title: No Keyboard Trap
requirements.description: If keyboard focus can be moved to a component, it can also be moved away

requirements.title: Character Key Shortcuts
requirements.description: If a keyboard shortcut is implemented, at least one of the following is true: turn off, remap, or active only on focus

implementation.compliance_method: Ensure all interactive elements are focusable via keyboard, proper focus management

2.2_enough_time.title: Enough Time
2.2_enough_time.description: Provide users enough time to read and use content

requirements.title: Timing Adjustable
requirements.description: For each time limit that is set by the content, the user can turn off, adjust, or extend it

requirements.title: Pause, Stop, Hide
requirements.description: For moving, blinking, or scrolling information, users can pause, stop, or hide it

implementation.compliance_method: No automatic timeouts or moving content that can't be controlled by user

2.3_seizures_and_physical_reactions.title: Seizures and Physical Reactions
2.3_seizures_and_physical_reactions.description: Do not design content in a way that is known to cause seizures or physical reactions

requirements.title: Three Flashes or Below Threshold
requirements.description: Content does not contain anything that flashes more than three times in any one second period

2.4_navigable.title: Navigable
2.4_navigable.description: Provide ways to help users navigate, find content, and determine where they are

requirements.title: Bypass Blocks
requirements.description: A mechanism is available to bypass blocks of content that are repeated on multiple Web pages

requirements.title: Page Titled
requirements.description: Web pages have titles that describe topic or purpose

requirements.title: Focus Order
requirements.description: If keyboard focus can be moved to a component, the focus order is logical and intuitive

requirements.title: Link Purpose
requirements.description: The purpose of each link can be determined from the link text alone or from the link text together with its programmatically determined link context

requirements.title: Multiple Ways
requirements.description: More than one way is available to locate a Web page within a set of Web pages

requirements.title: Headings and Labels
requirements.description: Headings and labels describe topic or purpose

requirements.title: Focus Visible
requirements.description: Any keyboard operable user interface has a mode of operation where the keyboard focus indicator is visible

implementation.compliance_method: Proper heading hierarchy, skip links, visible focus indicators, descriptive link text

3.1_readable.title: Readable
3.1_readable.description: Make text content readable and understandable

requirements.title: Language of Page
requirements.description: The default human language of each Web page can be programmatically determined

requirements.title: Language of Parts
requirements.description: The human language of each passage or phrase in the content can be programmatically determined

implementation.compliance_method: Set lang attribute on HTML element and for specific content as needed

3.2_predictable.title: Predictable
3.2_predictable.description: Make Web pages appear and operate in predictable ways

requirements.title: On Focus
requirements.description: Changing the setting of any user interface component does not automatically cause a change of context

requirements.title: On Input
requirements.description: Changing the setting of any user interface component does not automatically cause a change of context

requirements.title: Consistent Navigation
requirements.description: Navigational mechanisms that are repeated on multiple Web pages occur in the same relative order each time they are repeated

requirements.title: Consistent Identification
requirements.description: Components that have the same functionality within a set of Web pages are identified consistently

implementation.compliance_method: Consistent navigation, avoid unexpected changes on focus/input, consistent component identification

3.3_input_assistance.title: Input Assistance
3.3_input_assistance.description: Help users avoid and correct mistakes

requirements.title: Error Identification
requirements.description: If an input error is automatically detected, the item that is in error is identified and the error is described to the user in text

requirements.title: Labels or Instructions
requirements.description: Labels or instructions are provided when content requires user input

requirements.title: Error Suggestion
requirements.description: If an input error is automatically detected and suggestions for correction are known, then the suggestions are provided to the user

requirements.title: Error Prevention (Legal, Financial, Data)
requirements.description: For Web pages that cause legal commitments or financial transactions for the user to occur, or modify or delete user-controllable data in data storage systems, at least one of the following is true: reverible, checked, confirmed

implementation.compliance_method: Clear error messages, proper labeling, input validation, confirmation where needed

4.1_compatible.title: Compatible
4.1_compatible.description: Maximize compatibility with current and future user agents

requirements.title: Parsing
requirements.description: In content implemented using markup languages, elements have complete start and end tags, elements are nested according to their specifications, elements do not contain duplicate attributes, and any IDs are unique

requirements.title: Name, Role, Value
requirements.description: For all user interface components (including but not limited to form elements, links and components generated by scripts), the name and role can be programmatically determined

implementation.compliance_method: Valid HTML, proper ARIA attributes, programmatically determinable names and roles

color_contrast.test_method: Use automated tools like axe-core or manual contrast checkers

keyboard_navigation.focus_indicators: Visible focus indicators on all interactive elements
keyboard_navigation.tab_order: Logical tab order matching visual flow
keyboard_navigation.skip_links: Skip navigation links to main content
keyboard_navigation.testing_method: Navigate entirely with keyboard to ensure all functionality is accessible

alternative_text.informative_images: Brief, accurate description of content in alt attribute
alternative_text.functional_images: Description of function in alt attribute
alternative_text.complex_images: Detailed description in adjacent text or link to long description

headings_hierarchy.only_one_h1: Each page should have only one H1 tag
headings_hierarchy.logical_structure: Headings should follow a logical hierarchical structure (H1, H2, H3, etc.)
headings_hierarchy.descriptive_content: Headings should clearly describe the content that follows

compliance_reporting.audit_method: Combination of automated tools (axe-core) and manual testing
